Ehy guys, litte question: Someone have used the new menu function?
(<https://designers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions#menu>)

How can I use the `activeNode` prop when in a page which use the hubdb with other tables as child?
I can’t be of any help because I haven’t used this function yet, but thanks for mentioning this.  Looks like exciting stuff!
this looks like a password that was accidentally pasted in
I’ve used it but not with dynamic pages yet. <@U6GNQ7JBU> anything special for using active node for these pages or should it just work like other page types

<@U7SL518D6> atm, in a dynamic page, the activeNode is always to true for every voice of menu also with a structure like:
```
menu
  - submenu
     - another menu
        - voice to be active
     - this one is active too for the activeNode
```
hmmm, yea that seems to be a bug. <@U6W3H6YN8>
Well, I haven't found a way to solve this... I always set a web safe font as a fallback in this cases (font-family: 'Muli', Arial, verdana, sans-serif)
Is it possible to set up textarea for a custom module?
I don’t see it as an option from the field creator, and I’d prefer that over a rich text area.

So, is there any way to modify the Knowledge Base template? Even just slightly? Under settings > pages it looks as though you can edit the header/footer and add a file, but it doesn’t do anything. All I need to do is tweak it a little bit to be able to use it the way we want to. Right now it’s just too limited in comparison to our previous knowledge base tool. However, we would like to be able to use the HubSpot Knowledge Base for tracking/ticket purposes. Any tips?
As far as I know, I don't think you can edit the template itself, I only saw the CSS available for some tweaks and under FTP

I saw the CSS - but I can’t access it in any way. I connected via FTP and there’s no way for me to get to it (I read this post: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Knowledge-Base-Tool/Knowledge-base-styles/td-p/190409>) It says it doesn’t exist.
lol, yep I answered that long time ago. They maybe changed the path let me take a look
Ah I didn’t realize that was you! :sweat_smile:
wops, I don't have it anymore. But I think its because I don't really own it. I was only for the beta :sweat_smile:.
Anyway, templates & files is an alias for the old paths that were used some time ago. You should check on `designs` folder
that should be much more closer the real structure that you can see in the finder of the DM2
Ok - thanks for checking. I’ll take another look at it. I really wish they’d let us adjust the head html or attach files under the settings > pages tab.

yeah, can't agree more. We actually drop off the knowledge-base because its was (and still) very limited.

I would like to have more control over the whole template, until that happens I don't think I would recommend anyone the knowledge right now...
I handle those with the blog where you can basically do whatever you want
I think it would just be using the normal `text` one, i dont think there is a text limit on it

Same here. We’ve been debating using the blog instead. That might be the best option for us, too. We have two separate products that require information in the knowledge base… Without being able to customize it, it would just get way too mixed up and I think it’d be confusing for clients.
would nice to be able to show that as a text area though instead of a one line field

hmm, I kind of remember that there were like categories on the knowledge base, so maybe that's enough.
But if you have some time for it I would definitely go with the blog
And if you are going to do something pretty similar to the knowledge, you can always grab the generated DOM and the CSS and reconvert it as a blog template :grin:
Thanks, that’s a good idea! We’re probably gonna go with that. :+1:
